author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Crime Branch-Criminal Investigation Department, investigating into the ‘minor girl rape case’ filed the charge sheet before Fast Track Mahila Court here on Friday, arraigning 12 persons, including two medical practitioners and four juveniles.

The accused in the case included Selvi (40), the complainant in the case and aunt of the victim, Dr. Manivannan and Dr. Kannan, two medical practitioners who allegedly performed abortions on the victim, and four juveniles, including Selvi’s son, who were charged with raping the girl.

The CB-CID filed one charge sheet before the Fast Track Mahila Court in respect of 8 accused, and another before Juvenile Justice Board in respect of the 4 juvenile accused.

The case took a new twist when Selvi was affested after the victim disclosed that she was physically and mentally tortured by her.

The other accused included Sankar, SI attached to Town police station, and M. Namachivayam, conductor, Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation, who were arrested under the provisions of the POCSO Act. Aravind, Muthukumar and Abdul Ajis were the other accused. The two medical practitioners who were absconding and the other accused were arraigned based on her deposition before the Judicial Magistrate under Section 164 of the Code of Criminal Procedure.

Names of 12 persons, including two doctors and four juveniles, figure in it
title: CB-CID files charge sheet in minor girl rape case
